  <COMMENT line1="168" col1="1" line2="168" col2="80" start="29569" end="29648">################################################################################</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="169" col1="1" line2="169" col2="51" start="29745" end="29795">### Overview plot function for SingleCellExperiment</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="171" col1="1" line2="171" col2="47" start="30097" end="30143">#' Plot an overview of expression for each cell</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="172" col1="1" line2="172" col2="2" start="30273" end="30274">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="173" col1="1" line2="173" col2="79" start="30449" end="30527">#' Plot the relative proportion of the library accounted for by the most highly</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="174" col1="1" line2="174" col2="79" start="30625" end="30703">#' expressed features for each cell for an \code{SingleCellExperiment} dataset.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="175" col1="1" line2="175" col2="2" start="30801" end="30802">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="176" col1="1" line2="176" col2="49" start="30977" end="31025">#' @param x an \code{SingleCellExperiment} object</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="177" col1="1" line2="177" col2="82" start="31153" end="31234">#' @param block1 character string defining the column of \code{colData(object)} to</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="178" col1="1" line2="178" col2="75" start="31329" end="31403">#' be used as a factor by which to separate the cells into blocks (separate</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="179" col1="1" line2="179" col2="73" start="31505" end="31577">#' panels) in the plot. Default is \code{NULL}, in which case there is no</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="180" col1="1" line2="180" col2="12" start="31681" end="31692">#' blocking.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="181" col1="1" line2="181" col2="82" start="31857" end="31938">#' @param block2 character string defining the column of \code{colData(object)} to</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="182" col1="1" line2="182" col2="75" start="32033" end="32107">#' be used as a factor by which to separate the cells into blocks (separate</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="183" col1="1" line2="183" col2="73" start="32209" end="32281">#' panels) in the plot. Default is \code{NULL}, in which case there is no</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="184" col1="1" line2="184" col2="12" start="32385" end="32396">#' blocking.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="185" col1="1" line2="185" col2="85" start="32561" end="32645">#' @param colour_by character string defining the column of \code{colData(object)} to</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="186" col1="1" line2="186" col2="80" start="32737" end="32816">#' be used as a factor by which to colour the points in the plot. Alternatively,</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="187" col1="1" line2="187" col2="79" start="32913" end="32991">#' a data frame with one column containing a value for each cell, which will be</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="188" col1="1" line2="188" col2="36" start="33089" end="33124">#' mapped to a corresponding colour.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="189" col1="1" line2="189" col2="79" start="33265" end="33343">#' @param nfeatures numeric scalar indicating the number of features to include</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="190" col1="1" line2="190" col2="15" start="33441" end="33455">#' in the plot.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="191" col1="1" line2="191" col2="78" start="33617" end="33694">#' @param exprs_values character string indicating which values should be used</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="192" col1="1" line2="192" col2="75" start="33793" end="33867">#' as the expression values for this plot. Valid arguments are \code{"tpm"}</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="193" col1="1" line2="193" col2="82" start="33969" end="34050">#' (transcripts per million), \code{"counts"} (raw counts) [default], \code{"cpm"}</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="194" col1="1" line2="194" col2="56" start="34145" end="34200">#' (counts per million), or \code{"fpkm"} (FPKM values).</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="195" col1="1" line2="195" col2="74" start="34321" end="34394">#' @param linewidth numeric scalar giving the "size" parameter (in ggplot2</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="196" col1="1" line2="196" col2="51" start="34497" end="34547">#' parlance) for the lines plotted. Default is 1.5.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="197" col1="1" line2="197" col2="48" start="34673" end="34720">#' @param ... arguments passed to \code{plotSCE}</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="198" col1="1" line2="198" col2="82" start="34849" end="34930">#' @param ncol number of columns to use for \code{facet_wrap} if only one block is</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="199" col1="1" line2="199" col2="11" start="35025" end="35035">#' defined.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="200" col1="1" line2="200" col2="76" start="35201" end="35276">#' @param theme_size numeric scalar giving font size to use for the plotting</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="201" col1="1" line2="201" col2="8" start="35377" end="35384">#' theme</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="202" col1="1" line2="202" col2="2" start="35553" end="35554">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="203" col1="1" line2="203" col2="79" start="35729" end="35807">#' @details Plots produced by this function are intended to provide an overview</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="204" col1="1" line2="204" col2="76" start="35905" end="35980">#' of large-scale differences between cells. For each cell, the features are</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="205" col1="1" line2="205" col2="79" start="36081" end="36159">#' ordered from most-expressed to least-expressed and the cumulative proportion</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="206" col1="1" line2="206" col2="66" start="36257" end="36322">#' of the total expression for the cell is computed across the top</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="207" col1="1" line2="207" col2="73" start="36433" end="36505">#' \code{nfeatures} features. These plots can flag cells with a very high</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="208" col1="1" line2="208" col2="79" start="36609" end="36687">#' proportion of the library coming from a small number of features; such cells</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="209" col1="1" line2="209" col2="75" start="36785" end="36859">#' are likely to be problematic for analyses. Using the colour and blocking</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="210" col1="1" line2="210" col2="79" start="36961" end="37039">#' arguments can flag overall differences in cells under different experimental</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="211" col1="1" line2="211" col2="65" start="37137" end="37201">#' conditions or affected by different batch and other variables.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="212" col1="1" line2="212" col2="2" start="37313" end="37314">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="213" col1="1" line2="213" col2="31" start="37489" end="37519">#' @return a ggplot plot object</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="214" col1="1" line2="214" col2="2" start="37665" end="37666">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="215" col1="1" line2="215" col2="27" start="37841" end="37867">#' @importFrom dplyr mutate</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="216" col1="1" line2="216" col2="25" start="38017" end="38041">#' @importFrom plyr aaply</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="217" col1="1" line2="217" col2="28" start="38193" end="38220">#' @importFrom reshape2 melt</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="218" col1="1" line2="218" col2="10" start="38369" end="38378">#' @export</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="219" col1="1" line2="219" col2="2" start="38545" end="38546">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="220" col1="1" line2="220" col2="12" start="38721" end="38732">#' @examples</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="221" col1="1" line2="221" col2="44" start="38897" end="38940">#' ## Set up an example SingleCellExperiment</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="222" col1="1" line2="222" col2="28" start="39073" end="39100">#' data("sc_example_counts")</COMMENT>

  <COMMENT line1="226" col1="1" line2="226" col2="2" start="39777" end="39778">#'</COMMENT>

  <COMMENT line1="228" col1="1" line2="228" col2="77" start="40129" end="40205">#' plotScater(example_sce, exprs_values = "counts", colour_by = "Cell_Cycle")</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="229" col1="1" line2="229" col2="74" start="40305" end="40378">#' plotScater(example_sce, block1 = "Treatment", colour_by = "Cell_Cycle")</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="230" col1="1" line2="230" col2="2" start="40481" end="40482">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="231" col1="1" line2="231" col2="74" start="40657" end="40730">#' cpm(example_sce) &lt;- calculateCPM(example_sce, use.size.factors = FALSE)</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="232" col1="1" line2="232" col2="70" start="40833" end="40902">#' plotScater(example_sce, exprs_values = "cpm", block1 = "Treatment",</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="233" col1="1" line2="233" col2="56" start="41009" end="41064">#' block2 = "Mutation_Status", colour_by = "Cell_Cycle")</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="234" col1="1" line2="234" col2="66" start="41185" end="41250">#' # Error is thrown if chosen expression values are not available</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="235" col1="1" line2="235" col2="2" start="41361" end="41362">#'</COMMENT>
  <expr line1="236" col1="1" line2="331" col2="1" start="41537" end="58257">
    <expr line1="236" col1="1" line2="236" col2="10" start="41537" end="41546">
      <SYMBOL line1="236" col1="1" line2="236" col2="10" start="41537" end="41546">plotScater</SYMBOL>

    <LEFT_ASSIGN line1="236" col1="12" line2="236" col2="13" start="41548" end="41549">&lt;-</LEFT_ASSIGN>

  <COMMENT line1="338" col1="1" line2="338" col2="80" start="59489" end="59568">#' @param ntop numeric scalar indicating the number of most variable features to</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="339" col1="1" line2="339" col2="74" start="59665" end="59738">#' use for the PCA. Default is \code{500}, but any \code{ntop} argument is</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="340" col1="1" line2="340" col2="60" start="59841" end="59900">#' overrided if the \code{feature_set} argument is non-NULL.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="341" col1="1" line2="341" col2="78" start="60017" end="60094">#' @param exprs_values character string indicating which values should be used</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="342" col1="1" line2="342" col2="75" start="60193" end="60267">#' as the expression values for this plot. Valid arguments are \code{"tpm"}</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="343" col1="1" line2="343" col2="63" start="60369" end="60431">#' (transcripts per million), \code{"norm_tpm"} (normalised TPM</COMMENT>

  <COMMENT line1="345" col1="1" line2="345" col2="76" start="60721" end="60796">#' values), \code{"counts"} (counts for each feature), \code{"norm_counts"},</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="346" col1="1" line2="346" col2="67" start="60897" end="60963">#' \code{"cpm"} (counts-per-million), \code{"norm_cpm"} (normalised</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="347" col1="1" line2="347" col2="81" start="61073" end="61153">#' counts-per-million), \code{"logcounts"} (log-transformed count data; default),</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="348" col1="1" line2="348" col2="34" start="61249" end="61282">#' \code{"norm_exprs"} (normalised</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="349" col1="1" line2="349" col2="78" start="61425" end="61502">#' expression values) or \code{"stand_exprs"} (standardised expression values)</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="350" col1="1" line2="350" col2="90" start="61601" end="61690">#' or any other named element of the \code{assays} slot of the \code{SingleCellExperiment}</COMMENT>

  <COMMENT line1="451" col1="1" line2="451" col2="45" start="79377" end="79421">#' Plot PCA for a SingleCellExperiment object</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="452" col1="1" line2="452" col2="2" start="79553" end="79554">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="453" col1="1" line2="453" col2="78" start="79729" end="79806">#' Produce a principal components analysis (PCA) plot of two or more principal</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="454" col1="1" line2="454" col2="64" start="79905" end="79968">#' components for an \code{\link{SingleCellExperiment}} dataset.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="455" col1="1" line2="455" col2="2" start="80081" end="80082">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="456" col1="1" line2="456" col2="61" start="80257" end="80317">#' @param object an \code{\link{SingleCellExperiment}} object</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="457" col1="1" line2="457" col2="71" start="80433" end="80503">#' @param ncomponents numeric scalar indicating the number of principal</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="458" col1="1" line2="458" col2="78" start="80609" end="80686">#' components to plot, starting from the first principal component. Default is</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="459" col1="1" line2="459" col2="79" start="80785" end="80863">#' 2. If \code{ncomponents} is 2, then a scatterplot of PC2 vs PC1 is produced.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="460" col1="1" line2="460" col2="80" start="80961" end="81040">#' If \code{ncomponents} is greater than 2, a pairs plots for the top components</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="461" col1="1" line2="461" col2="15" start="81137" end="81151">#' is produced.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="462" col1="1" line2="462" col2="83" start="81313" end="81395">#' @param colour_by character string defining the column of \code{pData(object)} to</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="463" col1="1" line2="463" col2="80" start="81489" end="81568">#' be used as a factor by which to colour the points in the plot. Alternatively,</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="464" col1="1" line2="464" col2="83" start="81665" end="81747">#' a data frame with one column, containing values to map to colours for all cells.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="465" col1="1" line2="465" col2="82" start="81841" end="81922">#' @param shape_by character string defining the column of \code{pData(object)} to</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="466" col1="1" line2="466" col2="78" start="82017" end="82094">#' be used as a factor by which to define the shape of the points in the plot.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="467" col1="1" line2="467" col2="82" start="82193" end="82274">#' Alternatively, a data frame with one column containing values to map to shapes.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="468" col1="1" line2="468" col2="81" start="82369" end="82449">#' @param size_by character string defining the column of \code{pData(object)} to</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="469" col1="1" line2="469" col2="73" start="82545" end="82617">#' be used as a factor by which to define the size of points in the plot.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="470" col1="1" line2="470" col2="81" start="82721" end="82801">#' Alternatively, a data frame with one column containing values to map to sizes.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="471" col1="1" line2="471" col2="82" start="82897" end="82978">#' @param rerun logical, should PCA be recomputed even if \code{object} contains a</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="472" col1="1" line2="472" col2="48" start="83073" end="83120">#' "PCA" element in the \code{reducedDims} slot?</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="473" col1="1" line2="473" col2="87" start="83249" end="83335">#' @param return_SCE logical, should the function return an \code{SingleCellExperiment}</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="474" col1="1" line2="474" col2="58" start="83425" end="83482">#' object with principal component values for cells in the</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="475" col1="1" line2="475" col2="67" start="83601" end="83667">#' \code{reducedDim} slot. Default is \code{FALSE}, in which case a</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="476" col1="1" line2="476" col2="36" start="83777" end="83812">#' \code{ggplot} object is returned.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="477" col1="1" line2="477" col2="77" start="83953" end="84029">#' @param draw_plot logical, should the plot be drawn on the current graphics</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="478" col1="1" line2="478" col2="76" start="84129" end="84204">#' device? Only used if \code{return_SCE} is \code{TRUE}, otherwise the plot</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="479" col1="1" line2="479" col2="22" start="84305" end="84326">#' is always produced.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="480" col1="1" line2="480" col2="79" start="84481" end="84559">#' @param theme_size numeric scalar giving default font size for plotting theme</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="481" col1="1" line2="481" col2="19" start="84657" end="84675">#' (default is 10).</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="482" col1="1" line2="482" col2="77" start="84833" end="84909">#' @param legend character, specifying how the legend(s) be shown? Default is</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="483" col1="1" line2="483" col2="80" start="85009" end="85088">#' \code{"auto"}, which hides legends that have only one level and shows others.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="484" col1="1" line2="484" col2="74" start="85185" end="85258">#' Alternatives are "all" (show all legends) or "none" (hide all legends).</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="485" col1="1" line2="485" col2="2" start="85361" end="85362">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="486" col1="1" line2="486" col2="79" start="85537" end="85615">#' @details The function \code{\link{prcomp}} is used internally to do the PCA.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="487" col1="1" line2="487" col2="65" start="85713" end="85777">#' The function checks whether the \code{object} has standardised</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="488" col1="1" line2="488" col2="76" start="85889" end="85964">#' expression values (by looking at \code{stand_exprs(object)}). If yes, the</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="489" col1="1" line2="489" col2="77" start="86065" end="86141">#' existing standardised expression values are used for the PCA. If not, then</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="490" col1="1" line2="490" col2="78" start="86241" end="86318">#' standardised expression values are computed using \code{\link{scale}} (with</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="491" col1="1" line2="491" col2="76" start="86417" end="86492">#' feature-wise unit variances or not according to the \code{scale_features}</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="492" col1="1" line2="492" col2="78" start="86593" end="86670">#' argument), added to the object and PCA is done using these new standardised</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="493" col1="1" line2="493" col2="21" start="86769" end="86789">#' expression values.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="494" col1="1" line2="494" col2="2" start="86945" end="86946">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="495" col1="1" line2="495" col2="73" start="87121" end="87193">#' If the arguments \code{detect_outliers} and \code{return_SCE} are both</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="496" col1="1" line2="496" col2="70" start="87297" end="87366">#' \code{TRUE}, then the element \code{$outlier} is added to the pData</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="497" col1="1" line2="497" col2="89" start="87473" end="87561">#' (phenotype data) slot of the \code{SingleCellExperiment} object. This element contains</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="498" col1="1" line2="498" col2="76" start="87649" end="87724">#' indicator values about whether or not each cell has been designated as an</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="499" col1="1" line2="499" col2="71" start="87825" end="87895">#' outlier based on the PCA. These values can be accessed for filtering</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="500" col1="1" line2="500" col2="67" start="88001" end="88067">#' low quality cells with, for example, \code{example_sce$outlier}.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="501" col1="1" line2="501" col2="2" start="88177" end="88178">#'</COMMENT>

  <COMMENT line1="598" col1="1" line2="598" col2="12" start="105249" end="105260">### plotTSNE</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="600" col1="1" line2="600" col2="80" start="105601" end="105680">#' @param ntop numeric scalar indicating the number of most variable features to</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="601" col1="1" line2="601" col2="75" start="105777" end="105851">#' use for the t-SNE Default is \code{500}, but any \code{ntop} argument is</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="602" col1="1" line2="602" col2="60" start="105953" end="106012">#' overrided if the \code{feature_set} argument is non-NULL.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="603" col1="1" line2="603" col2="78" start="106129" end="106206">#' @param exprs_values character string indicating which values should be used</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="604" col1="1" line2="604" col2="75" start="106305" end="106379">#' as the expression values for this plot. Valid arguments are \code{"tpm"}</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="605" col1="1" line2="605" col2="63" start="106481" end="106543">#' (transcripts per million), \code{"norm_tpm"} (normalised TPM</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="606" col1="1" line2="606" col2="76" start="106657" end="106732">#' values), \code{"fpkm"} (FPKM values), \code{"norm_fpkm"} (normalised FPKM</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="607" col1="1" line2="607" col2="76" start="106833" end="106908">#' values), \code{"counts"} (counts for each feature), \code{"norm_counts"},</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="608" col1="1" line2="608" col2="67" start="107009" end="107075">#' \code{"cpm"} (counts-per-million), \code{"norm_cpm"} (normalised</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="609" col1="1" line2="609" col2="81" start="107185" end="107265">#' counts-per-million), \code{"logcounts"} (log-transformed count data; default),</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="610" col1="1" line2="610" col2="34" start="107361" end="107394">#' \code{"norm_exprs"} (normalised</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="611" col1="1" line2="611" col2="79" start="107537" end="107615">#' expression values) or \code{"stand_exprs"} (standardised expression values),</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="612" col1="1" line2="612" col2="93" start="107713" end="107805">#' or any other named element of the \code{assayData} slot of the \code{SingleCellExperiment}</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="613" col1="1" line2="613" col2="62" start="107889" end="107950">#' object that can be accessed with the \code{assay} function.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="614" col1="1" line2="614" col2="78" start="108065" end="108142">#' @param feature_set character, numeric or logical vector indicating a set of</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="615" col1="1" line2="615" col2="79" start="108241" end="108319">#' features to use for the t-SNE calculation. If character, entries must all be</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="616" col1="1" line2="616" col2="81" start="108417" end="108497">#' in \code{featureNames(object)}. If numeric, values are taken to be indices for</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="617" col1="1" line2="617" col2="80" start="108593" end="108672">#' features. If logical, vector is used to index features and should have length</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="618" col1="1" line2="618" col2="32" start="108769" end="108800">#' equal to \code{nrow(object)}.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="619" col1="1" line2="619" col2="86" start="108945" end="109030">#' @param use_dimred character(1), use named reduced dimension representation of cells</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="620" col1="1" line2="620" col2="84" start="109121" end="109204">#' stored in \code{SingleCellExperiment} object instead of recomputing (e.g. "PCA").</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="621" col1="1" line2="621" col2="85" start="109297" end="109381">#'  Default is \code{NULL}, no reduced dimension values are provided to \code{Rtsne}.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="622" col1="1" line2="622" col2="81" start="109473" end="109553">#' @param n_dimred integer(1), number of components of the reduced dimension slot</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="623" col1="1" line2="623" col2="90" start="109649" end="109738">#' to use. Default is \code{NULL}, in which case (if \code{use_dimred} is not \code{NULL})</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="624" col1="1" line2="624" col2="57" start="109825" end="109881">#' all components of the reduced dimension slot are used.</COMMENT>

  <COMMENT line1="687" col1="1" line2="687" col2="48" start="120913" end="120960">#' Plot t-SNE for an SingleCellExperiment object</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="688" col1="1" line2="688" col2="2" start="121089" end="121090">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="689" col1="1" line2="689" col2="77" start="121265" end="121341">#' Produce a t-distributed stochastic neighbour embedding (t-SNE) plot of two</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="690" col1="1" line2="690" col2="57" start="121441" end="121497">#' components for an \code{SingleCellExperiment} dataset.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="691" col1="1" line2="691" col2="2" start="121617" end="121618">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="692" col1="1" line2="692" col2="54" start="121793" end="121846">#' @param object an \code{SingleCellExperiment} object</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="693" col1="1" line2="693" col2="67" start="121969" end="122035">#' @param ncomponents numeric scalar indicating the number of t-SNE</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="694" col1="1" line2="694" col2="74" start="122145" end="122218">#' components to plot, starting from the first t-SNE component. Default is</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="695" col1="1" line2="695" col2="80" start="122321" end="122400">#' 2. If \code{ncomponents} is 2, then a scatterplot of component 1 vs component</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="696" col1="1" line2="696" col2="80" start="122497" end="122576">#' 2 is produced. If \code{ncomponents} is greater than 2, a pairs plots for the</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="697" col1="1" line2="697" col2="79" start="122673" end="122751">#' top components is produced. NB: computing more than two components for t-SNE</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="698" col1="1" line2="698" col2="34" start="122849" end="122882">#' can become very time consuming.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="699" col1="1" line2="699" col2="83" start="123025" end="123107">#' @param colour_by character string defining the column of \code{pData(object)} to</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="700" col1="1" line2="700" col2="80" start="123201" end="123280">#' be used as a factor by which to colour the points in the plot. Alternatively,</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="701" col1="1" line2="701" col2="82" start="123377" end="123458">#' a data frame with one column containing values to map to colours for all cells.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="702" col1="1" line2="702" col2="82" start="123553" end="123634">#' @param shape_by character string defining the column of \code{pData(object)} to</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="703" col1="1" line2="703" col2="78" start="123729" end="123806">#' be used as a factor by which to define the shape of the points in the plot.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="704" col1="1" line2="704" col2="82" start="123905" end="123986">#' Alternatively, a data frame with one column containing values to map to shapes.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="705" col1="1" line2="705" col2="81" start="124081" end="124161">#' @param size_by character string defining the column of \code{pData(object)} to</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="706" col1="1" line2="706" col2="73" start="124257" end="124329">#' be used as a factor by which to define the size of points in the plot.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="707" col1="1" line2="707" col2="81" start="124433" end="124513">#' Alternatively, a data frame with one column containing values to map to sizes.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="708" col1="1" line2="708" col2="87" start="124609" end="124695">#' @param return_SCE logical, should the function return an \code{SingleCellExperiment}</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="709" col1="1" line2="709" col2="58" start="124785" end="124842">#' object with principal component values for cells in the</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="710" col1="1" line2="710" col2="68" start="124961" end="125028">#' \code{reducedDims} slot. Default is \code{FALSE}, in which case a</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="711" col1="1" line2="711" col2="36" start="125137" end="125172">#' \code{ggplot} object is returned.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="712" col1="1" line2="712" col2="82" start="125313" end="125394">#' @param rerun logical, should PCA be recomputed even if \code{object} contains a</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="713" col1="1" line2="713" col2="48" start="125489" end="125536">#' "PCA" element in the \code{reducedDims} slot?</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="714" col1="1" line2="714" col2="77" start="125665" end="125741">#' @param draw_plot logical, should the plot be drawn on the current graphics</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="715" col1="1" line2="715" col2="76" start="125841" end="125916">#' device? Only used if \code{return_SCE} is \code{TRUE}, otherwise the plot</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="716" col1="1" line2="716" col2="22" start="126017" end="126038">#' is always produced.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="717" col1="1" line2="717" col2="79" start="126193" end="126271">#' @param theme_size numeric scalar giving default font size for plotting theme</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="718" col1="1" line2="718" col2="19" start="126369" end="126387">#' (default is 10).</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="719" col1="1" line2="719" col2="77" start="126545" end="126621">#' @param legend character, specifying how the legend(s) be shown? Default is</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="720" col1="1" line2="720" col2="80" start="126721" end="126800">#' \code{"auto"}, which hides legends that have only one level and shows others.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="721" col1="1" line2="721" col2="74" start="126897" end="126970">#' Alternatives are "all" (show all legends) or "none" (hide all legends).</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="722" col1="1" line2="722" col2="68" start="127073" end="127140">#' @param ... further arguments passed to \code{\link[Rtsne]{Rtsne}}</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="723" col1="1" line2="723" col2="2" start="127249" end="127250">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="724" col1="1" line2="724" col2="73" start="127425" end="127497">#' @details The function \code{\link[Rtsne]{Rtsne}} is used internally to</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="725" col1="1" line2="725" col2="80" start="127601" end="127680">#' compute the t-SNE. Note that the algorithm is not deterministic, so different</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="726" col1="1" line2="726" col2="80" start="127777" end="127856">#' runs of the function will produce differing plots (see \code{\link{set.seed}}</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="727" col1="1" line2="727" col2="65" start="127953" end="128017">#' to set a random seed for replicable results). The value of the</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="728" col1="1" line2="728" col2="80" start="128129" end="128208">#' \code{perplexity} parameter can have a large effect on the resulting plot, so</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="729" col1="1" line2="729" col2="79" start="128305" end="128383">#' it can often be worthwhile to try multiple values to find the most appealing</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="730" col1="1" line2="730" col2="17" start="128481" end="128497">#' visualisation.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="731" col1="1" line2="731" col2="2" start="128657" end="128658">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="732" col1="1" line2="732" col2="75" start="128833" end="128907">#' @return If \code{return_SCE} is \code{TRUE}, then the function returns a</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="733" col1="1" line2="733" col2="83" start="129009" end="129091">#' \code{SingleCellExperiment} object, otherwise it returns a \code{ggplot} object.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="734" col1="1" line2="734" col2="17" start="129185" end="129201">#' @name plotTSNE</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="735" col1="1" line2="735" col2="19" start="129361" end="129379">#' @rdname plotTSNE</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="736" col1="1" line2="736" col2="57" start="129537" end="129593">#' @aliases plotTSNE plotTSNE,SingleCellExperiment-method</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="737" col1="1" line2="737" col2="2" start="129713" end="129714">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="738" col1="1" line2="738" col2="10" start="129889" end="129898">#' @export</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="739" col1="1" line2="739" col2="11" start="130065" end="130075">#' @seealso</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="740" col1="1" line2="740" col2="29" start="130241" end="130269">#' \code{\link[Rtsne]{Rtsne}}</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="741" col1="1" line2="741" col2="14" start="130417" end="130430">#' @references</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="742" col1="1" line2="742" col2="77" start="130593" end="130669">#' L.J.P. van der Maaten. Barnes-Hut-SNE. In Proceedings of the International</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="743" col1="1" line2="743" col2="48" start="130769" end="130816">#' Conference on Learning Representations, 2013.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="744" col1="1" line2="744" col2="2" start="130945" end="130946">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="745" col1="1" line2="745" col2="12" start="131121" end="131132">#' @examples</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="746" col1="1" line2="746" col2="44" start="131297" end="131340">#' ## Set up an example SingleCellExperiment</COMMENT>

  <COMMENT line1="792" col1="1" line2="792" col2="20" start="139393" end="139412">### plotDiffusionMap</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="794" col1="1" line2="794" col2="80" start="139745" end="139824">#' @param ntop numeric scalar indicating the number of most variable features to</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="795" col1="1" line2="795" col2="72" start="139921" end="139992">#' use for the diffusion map. Default is \code{500}, but any \code{ntop}</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="796" col1="1" line2="796" col2="72" start="140097" end="140168">#' argument is overrided if the \code{feature_set} argument is non-NULL.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="797" col1="1" line2="797" col2="78" start="140273" end="140350">#' @param exprs_values character string indicating which values should be used</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="798" col1="1" line2="798" col2="75" start="140449" end="140523">#' as the expression values for this plot. Valid arguments are \code{"tpm"}</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="799" col1="1" line2="799" col2="63" start="140625" end="140687">#' (transcripts per million), \code{"norm_tpm"} (normalised TPM</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="800" col1="1" line2="800" col2="76" start="140801" end="140876">#' values), \code{"fpkm"} (FPKM values), \code{"norm_fpkm"} (normalised FPKM</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="801" col1="1" line2="801" col2="76" start="140977" end="141052">#' values), \code{"counts"} (counts for each feature), \code{"norm_counts"},</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="802" col1="1" line2="802" col2="67" start="141153" end="141219">#' \code{"cpm"} (counts-per-million), \code{"norm_cpm"} (normalised</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="803" col1="1" line2="803" col2="81" start="141329" end="141409">#' counts-per-million), \code{"logcounts"} (log-transformed count data; default),</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="804" col1="1" line2="804" col2="34" start="141505" end="141538">#' \code{"norm_exprs"} (normalised</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="805" col1="1" line2="805" col2="78" start="141681" end="141758">#' expression values) or \code{"stand_exprs"} (standardised expression values)</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="806" col1="1" line2="806" col2="93" start="141857" end="141949">#' or any other named element of the \code{assayData} slot of the \code{SingleCellExperiment}</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="807" col1="1" line2="807" col2="62" start="142033" end="142094">#' object that can be accessed with the \code{assay} function.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="808" col1="1" line2="808" col2="78" start="142209" end="142286">#' @param feature_set character, numeric or logical vector indicating a set of</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="809" col1="1" line2="809" col2="78" start="142385" end="142462">#' features to use for the diffusion map. If character, entries must all be in</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="810" col1="1" line2="810" col2="78" start="142561" end="142638">#' \code{featureNames(object)}. If numeric, values are taken to be indices for</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="811" col1="1" line2="811" col2="80" start="142737" end="142816">#' features. If logical, vector is used to index features and should have length</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="812" col1="1" line2="812" col2="32" start="142913" end="142944">#' equal to \code{nrow(object)}.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="813" col1="1" line2="813" col2="78" start="143089" end="143166">#' @param scale_features logical, should the expression values be standardised</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="814" col1="1" line2="814" col2="66" start="143265" end="143330">#' so that each feature has unit variance? Default is \code{TRUE}.</COMMENT>

  <COMMENT line1="817" col1="1" line2="817" col2="85" start="143793" end="143877">#'  Default is \code{NULL}, no reduced dimension values are provided to \code{Rtsne}.</COMMENT>

              <SLOT line1="870" col1="54" line2="870" col2="65" start="153174" end="153185">eigenvectors</SLOT>
            </expr>
            <OP-LEFT-BRACKET line1="870" col1="66" line2="870" col2="66" start="153186" end="153186">[</OP-LEFT-BRACKET>
            <OP-COMMA line1="870" col1="67" line2="870" col2="67" start="153187" end="153187">,</OP-COMMA>
            <expr line1="870" col1="69" line2="870" col2="88" start="153189" end="153208">
              <expr line1="870" col1="69" line2="870" col2="75" start="153189" end="153195">
                <SYMBOL_FUNCTION_CALL line1="870" col1="69" line2="870" col2="75" start="153189" end="153195">seq_len</SYMBOL_FUNCTION_CALL>
              </expr>
              <OP-LEFT-PAREN line1="870" col1="76" line2="870" col2="76" start="153196" end="153196">(</OP-LEFT-PAREN>
              <expr line1="870" col1="77" line2="870" col2="87" start="153197" end="153207">
                <SYMBOL line1="870" col1="77" line2="870" col2="87" start="153197" end="153207">ncomponents</SYMBOL>
              </expr>
              <OP-RIGHT-PAREN line1="870" col1="88" line2="870" col2="88" start="153208" end="153208">)</OP-RIGHT-PAREN>
            </expr>
            <OP-COMMA line1="870" col1="89" line2="870" col2="89" start="153209" end="153209">,</OP-COMMA>
            <SYMBOL_SUB line1="870" col1="91" line2="870" col2="94" start="153211" end="153214">drop</SYMBOL_SUB>
            <EQ_SUB line1="870" col1="96" line2="870" col2="96" start="153216" end="153216">=</EQ_SUB>
            <expr line1="870" col1="98" line2="870" col2="102" start="153218" end="153222">
              <NUM_CONST line1="870" col1="98" line2="870" col2="102" start="153218" end="153222">FALSE</NUM_CONST>
            </expr>
            <OP-RIGHT-BRACKET line1="870" col1="103" line2="870" col2="103" start="153223" end="153223">]</OP-RIGHT-BRACKET>
          </expr>
        </expr>
        <expr line1="871" col1="5" line2="871" col2="18" start="153301" end="153314">
          <expr line1="871" col1="5" line2="871" col2="10" start="153301" end="153306">
            <SYMBOL_FUNCTION_CALL line1="871" col1="5" line2="871" col2="10" start="153301" end="153306">return</SYMBOL_FUNCTION_CALL>
          </expr>
          <OP-LEFT-PAREN line1="871" col1="11" line2="871" col2="11" start="153307" end="153307">(</OP-LEFT-PAREN>
          <expr line1="871" col1="12" line2="871" col2="17" start="153308" end="153313">
            <SYMBOL line1="871" col1="12" line2="871" col2="17" start="153308" end="153313">object</SYMBOL>
          </expr>
          <OP-RIGHT-PAREN line1="871" col1="18" line2="871" col2="18" start="153314" end="153314">)</OP-RIGHT-PAREN>
        </expr>
        <OP-RIGHT-BRACE line1="872" col1="1" line2="872" col2="1" start="153473" end="153473">}</OP-RIGHT-BRACE>
      </expr>
    </expr>
  </expr>
  <COMMENT line1="874" col1="1" line2="874" col2="57" start="153825" end="153881">#' Plot a diffusion map for a SingleCellExperiment object</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="875" col1="1" line2="875" col2="2" start="154001" end="154002">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="876" col1="1" line2="876" col2="93" start="154177" end="154269">#' Produce a diffusion map plot of two components for an \code{SingleCellExperiment} dataset.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="877" col1="1" line2="877" col2="2" start="154353" end="154354">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="878" col1="1" line2="878" col2="54" start="154529" end="154582">#' @param object an \code{SingleCellExperiment} object</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="879" col1="1" line2="879" col2="71" start="154705" end="154775">#' @param ncomponents numeric scalar indicating the number of principal</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="880" col1="1" line2="880" col2="79" start="154881" end="154959">#' components to plot, starting from the first diffusion map component. Default</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="881" col1="1" line2="881" col2="73" start="155057" end="155129">#' is 2. If \code{ncomponents} is 2, then a scatterplot of component 1 vs</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="882" col1="1" line2="882" col2="76" start="155233" end="155308">#' component 2 is produced. If \code{ncomponents} is greater than 2, a pairs</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="883" col1="1" line2="883" col2="78" start="155409" end="155486">#' plots for the top components is produced. NB: computing many components for</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="884" col1="1" line2="884" col2="47" start="155585" end="155631">#' the diffusion map can become time consuming.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="885" col1="1" line2="885" col2="83" start="155761" end="155843">#' @param colour_by character string defining the column of \code{pData(object)} to</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="886" col1="1" line2="886" col2="82" start="155937" end="156018">#' be used as a factor by which to colour the points in the plot. Alternatively, a</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="887" col1="1" line2="887" col2="80" start="156113" end="156192">#' data frame with one column containing values to map to colours for all cells.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="888" col1="1" line2="888" col2="82" start="156289" end="156370">#' @param shape_by character string defining the column of \code{pData(object)} to</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="889" col1="1" line2="889" col2="78" start="156465" end="156542">#' be used as a factor by which to define the shape of the points in the plot.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="890" col1="1" line2="890" col2="81" start="156641" end="156721">#' @param size_by character string defining the column of \code{pData(object)} to</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="891" col1="1" line2="891" col2="73" start="156817" end="156889">#' be used as a factor by which to define the size of points in the plot.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="892" col1="1" line2="892" col2="87" start="156993" end="157079">#' @param return_SCE logical, should the function return an \code{SingleCellExperiment}</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="893" col1="1" line2="893" col2="58" start="157169" end="157226">#' object with principal component values for cells in the</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="894" col1="1" line2="894" col2="68" start="157345" end="157412">#' \code{reducedDims} slot. Default is \code{FALSE}, in which case a</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="895" col1="1" line2="895" col2="36" start="157521" end="157556">#' \code{ggplot} object is returned.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="896" col1="1" line2="896" col2="82" start="157697" end="157778">#' @param rerun logical, should PCA be recomputed even if \code{object} contains a</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="897" col1="1" line2="897" col2="48" start="157873" end="157920">#' "PCA" element in the \code{reducedDims} slot?</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="898" col1="1" line2="898" col2="77" start="158049" end="158125">#' @param draw_plot logical, should the plot be drawn on the current graphics</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="899" col1="1" line2="899" col2="76" start="158225" end="158300">#' device? Only used if \code{return_SCE} is \code{TRUE}, otherwise the plot</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="900" col1="1" line2="900" col2="22" start="158401" end="158422">#' is always produced.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="901" col1="1" line2="901" col2="79" start="158577" end="158655">#' @param theme_size numeric scalar giving default font size for plotting theme</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="902" col1="1" line2="902" col2="19" start="158753" end="158771">#' (default is 10).</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="903" col1="1" line2="903" col2="77" start="158929" end="159005">#' @param legend character, specifying how the legend(s) be shown? Default is</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="904" col1="1" line2="904" col2="80" start="159105" end="159184">#' \code{"auto"}, which hides legends that have only one level and shows others.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="905" col1="1" line2="905" col2="74" start="159281" end="159354">#' Alternatives are "all" (show all legends) or "none" (hide all legends).</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="906" col1="1" line2="906" col2="77" start="159457" end="159533">#' @param ... further arguments passed to \code{\link[destiny]{DiffusionMap}}</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="907" col1="1" line2="907" col2="2" start="159633" end="159634">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="908" col1="1" line2="908" col2="79" start="159809" end="159887">#' @details The function \code{\link[destiny]{DiffusionMap}} is used internally</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="909" col1="1" line2="909" col2="32" start="159985" end="160016">#' to compute the diffusion map.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="910" col1="1" line2="910" col2="2" start="160161" end="160162">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="911" col1="1" line2="911" col2="76" start="160337" end="160412">#' @return If \code{return_SCE} is \code{TRUE}, then the function returns an</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="912" col1="1" line2="912" col2="83" start="160513" end="160595">#' \code{SingleCellExperiment} object, otherwise it returns a \code{ggplot} object.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="913" col1="1" line2="913" col2="25" start="160689" end="160713">#' @name plotDiffusionMap</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="914" col1="1" line2="914" col2="27" start="160865" end="160891">#' @rdname plotDiffusionMap</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="915" col1="1" line2="915" col2="73" start="161041" end="161113">#' @aliases plotDiffusionMap plotDiffusionMap,SingleCellExperiment-method</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="916" col1="1" line2="916" col2="2" start="161217" end="161218">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="917" col1="1" line2="917" col2="10" start="161393" end="161402">#' @export</COMMENT>

  <COMMENT line1="922" col1="1" line2="922" col2="2" start="162273" end="162274">#'</COMMENT>

        <expr line1="954" col1="5" line2="956" col2="5" start="167909" end="168261">

  <COMMENT line1="1017" col1="1" line2="1017" col2="76" start="178993" end="179068">#' Produce a multidimensional scaling plot for a SingleCellExperiment object</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1018" col1="1" line2="1018" col2="2" start="179169" end="179170">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1019" col1="1" line2="1019" col2="68" start="179345" end="179412">#' #' Produce an MDS plot from the cell pairwise distance data in an</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1020" col1="1" line2="1020" col2="39" start="179521" end="179559">#' \code{SingleCellExperiment} dataset.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1021" col1="1" line2="1021" col2="2" start="179697" end="179698">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1022" col1="1" line2="1022" col2="54" start="179873" end="179926">#' @param object an \code{SingleCellExperiment} object</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1023" col1="1" line2="1023" col2="71" start="180049" end="180119">#' @param ncomponents numeric scalar indicating the number of principal</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1024" col1="1" line2="1024" col2="78" start="180225" end="180302">#' components to plot, starting from the first principal component. Default is</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1025" col1="1" line2="1025" col2="79" start="180401" end="180479">#' 2. If \code{ncomponents} is 2, then a scatterplot of PC2 vs PC1 is produced.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1026" col1="1" line2="1026" col2="80" start="180577" end="180656">#' If \code{ncomponents} is greater than 2, a pairs plots for the top components</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1027" col1="1" line2="1027" col2="80" start="180753" end="180832">#' is produced. NB: computing more than two components for t-SNE can become very</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1028" col1="1" line2="1028" col2="18" start="180929" end="180946">#' time consuming.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1029" col1="1" line2="1029" col2="83" start="181105" end="181187">#' @param colour_by character string defining the column of \code{pData(object)} to</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1030" col1="1" line2="1030" col2="82" start="181281" end="181362">#' be used as a factor by which to colour the points in the plot. Alternatively, a</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1031" col1="1" line2="1031" col2="80" start="181457" end="181536">#' data frame with one column containing values to map to colours for all cells.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1032" col1="1" line2="1032" col2="82" start="181633" end="181714">#' @param shape_by character string defining the column of \code{pData(object)} to</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1033" col1="1" line2="1033" col2="78" start="181809" end="181886">#' be used as a factor by which to define the shape of the points in the plot.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1034" col1="1" line2="1034" col2="81" start="181985" end="182065">#' @param size_by character string defining the column of \code{pData(object)} to</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1035" col1="1" line2="1035" col2="73" start="182161" end="182233">#' be used as a factor by which to define the size of points in the plot.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1036" col1="1" line2="1036" col2="87" start="182337" end="182423">#' @param return_SCE logical, should the function return an \code{SingleCellExperiment}</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1037" col1="1" line2="1037" col2="58" start="182513" end="182570">#' object with principal component values for cells in the</COMMENT>

  <COMMENT line1="1106" col1="1" line2="1106" col2="18" start="194657" end="194674">### plotReducedDim</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1108" col1="1" line2="1108" col2="49" start="195009" end="195057">#' Plot reduced dimension representation of cells</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1109" col1="1" line2="1109" col2="2" start="195185" end="195186">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1110" col1="1" line2="1110" col2="94" start="195361" end="195454">#' @param object an \code{SingleCellExperiment} object with a non-NULL \code{reducedDimension}</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1111" col1="1" line2="1111" col2="8" start="195537" end="195544">#' slot.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1112" col1="1" line2="1112" col2="81" start="195713" end="195793">#' @param use_dimred character, name of reduced dimension representation of cells</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1113" col1="1" line2="1113" col2="82" start="195889" end="195970">#' stored in \code{SingleCellExperiment} object to plot (e.g. "PCA", "TSNE", etc).</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1114" col1="1" line2="1114" col2="79" start="196065" end="196143">#' @param df_to_plot data.frame containing a reduced dimension represenation of</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1115" col1="1" line2="1115" col2="44" start="196241" end="196284">#' cells and optional metadata for the plot.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1116" col1="1" line2="1116" col2="71" start="196417" end="196487">#' @param ncomponents numeric scalar indicating the number of principal</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1117" col1="1" line2="1117" col2="78" start="196593" end="196670">#' components to plot, starting from the first principal component. Default is</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1118" col1="1" line2="1118" col2="80" start="196769" end="196848">#' 2. If \code{ncomponents} is 2, then a scatterplot of Dimension 2 vs Dimension</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1119" col1="1" line2="1119" col2="80" start="196945" end="197024">#' 1 is produced. If \code{ncomponents} is greater than 2, a pairs plots for the</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1120" col1="1" line2="1120" col2="31" start="197121" end="197151">#'  top dimensions is produced.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1121" col1="1" line2="1121" col2="83" start="197297" end="197379">#' @param colour_by character string defining the column of \code{pData(object)} to</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1122" col1="1" line2="1122" col2="82" start="197473" end="197554">#' be used as a factor by which to colour the points in the plot. Alternatively, a</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1123" col1="1" line2="1123" col2="80" start="197649" end="197728">#' data frame with one column containing values to map to colours for all cells.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1124" col1="1" line2="1124" col2="82" start="197825" end="197906">#' @param shape_by character string defining the column of \code{pData(object)} to</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1125" col1="1" line2="1125" col2="78" start="198001" end="198078">#' be used as a factor by which to define the shape of the points in the plot.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1126" col1="1" line2="1126" col2="81" start="198177" end="198257">#' @param size_by character string defining the column of \code{pData(object)} to</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1127" col1="1" line2="1127" col2="73" start="198353" end="198425">#' be used as a factor by which to define the size of points in the plot.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1128" col1="1" line2="1128" col2="72" start="198529" end="198600">#' @param percentVar numeric vector giving the proportion of variance in</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1129" col1="1" line2="1129" col2="75" start="198705" end="198779">#' expression explained by each reduced dimension. Only expected to be used</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1130" col1="1" line2="1130" col2="60" start="198881" end="198940">#' internally in the \code{\link[scater]{plotPCA}} function.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1131" col1="1" line2="1131" col2="75" start="199057" end="199131">#' @param exprs_values a string specifying the expression values to use for</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1132" col1="1" line2="1132" col2="88" start="199233" end="199320">#' colouring the points, if \code{colour_by} or \code{size_by} are set as feature names.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1133" col1="1" line2="1133" col2="79" start="199409" end="199487">#' @param theme_size numeric scalar giving default font size for plotting theme</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1134" col1="1" line2="1134" col2="19" start="199585" end="199603">#' (default is 10).</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1135" col1="1" line2="1135" col2="77" start="199761" end="199837">#' @param legend character, specifying how the legend(s) be shown? Default is</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1136" col1="1" line2="1136" col2="80" start="199937" end="200016">#' \code{"auto"}, which hides legends that have only one level and shows others.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1137" col1="1" line2="1137" col2="74" start="200113" end="200186">#' Alternatives are "all" (show all legends) or "none" (hide all legends).</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1138" col1="1" line2="1138" col2="68" start="200289" end="200356">#' @param ... optional arguments (from those listed above) passed to</COMMENT>

  <COMMENT line1="1141" col1="1" line2="1141" col2="77" start="200817" end="200893">#' @details The function \code{plotReducedDim.default} assumes that the first</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1142" col1="1" line2="1142" col2="80" start="200993" end="201072">#' \code{ncomponents} columns of \code{df_to_plot} contain the reduced dimension</COMMENT>

  <COMMENT line1="1144" col1="1" line2="1144" col2="69" start="201345" end="201413">#'  \code{colour_by}, \code{shape_by} and \code{size_by} in the plot.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1145" col1="1" line2="1145" col2="2" start="201521" end="201522">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1146" col1="1" line2="1146" col2="31" start="201697" end="201727">#' @return a ggplot plot object</COMMENT>

      <OP-LEFT-PAREN line1="1171" col1="34" line2="1171" col2="34" start="206130" end="206130">(</OP-LEFT-PAREN>

  <COMMENT line1="1359" col1="1" line2="1359" col2="80" start="239185" end="239264">################################################################################</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1360" col1="1" line2="1360" col2="33" start="239361" end="239393">### Plot cells in plate positions</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1362" col1="1" line2="1362" col2="32" start="239713" end="239744">#' Plot cells in plate positions</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1363" col1="1" line2="1363" col2="2" start="239889" end="239890">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1364" col1="1" line2="1364" col2="74" start="240065" end="240138">#' Plots cells in their position on a plate, coloured by phenotype data or</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1365" col1="1" line2="1365" col2="22" start="240241" end="240262">#' feature expression.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1366" col1="1" line2="1366" col2="2" start="240417" end="240418">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1367" col1="1" line2="1367" col2="94" start="240593" end="240686">#' @param object an \code{SingleCellExperiment} object. If \code{object$plate_position} is not</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1368" col1="1" line2="1368" col2="76" start="240769" end="240844">#' \code{NULL}, then this will be used to define each cell's position on the</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1369" col1="1" line2="1369" col2="65" start="240945" end="241009">#' plate, unless the \code{plate_position} argument is specified.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1370" col1="1" line2="1370" col2="78" start="241121" end="241198">#' @param plate_position optional character vector providing a position on the</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1371" col1="1" line2="1371" col2="74" start="241297" end="241370">#' plate for each cell (e.g. A01, B12, etc, where letter indicates row and</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1372" col1="1" line2="1372" col2="73" start="241473" end="241545">#' number indicates column). Specifying this argument overrides any plate</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1373" col1="1" line2="1373" col2="71" start="241649" end="241719">#' position information extracted from the SingleCellExperiment object.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1374" col1="1" line2="1374" col2="83" start="241825" end="241907">#' @param colour_by character string defining the column of \code{pData(object)} to</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1375" col1="1" line2="1375" col2="82" start="242001" end="242082">#' be used as a factor by which to colour the points in the plot. Alternatively, a</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1376" col1="1" line2="1376" col2="80" start="242177" end="242256">#' data frame with one column containing values to map to colours for all cells.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1377" col1="1" line2="1377" col2="76" start="242353" end="242428">#' @param x_position numeric vector providing x-axis positions for the cells</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1378" col1="1" line2="1378" col2="56" start="242529" end="242584">#' (ignored if \code{plate_position} is not \code{NULL})</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1379" col1="1" line2="1379" col2="76" start="242705" end="242780">#' @param y_position numeric vector providing y-axis positions for the cells</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1380" col1="1" line2="1380" col2="56" start="242881" end="242936">#' (ignored if \code{plate_position} is not \code{NULL})</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1381" col1="1" line2="1381" col2="75" start="243057" end="243131">#' @param exprs_values a string specifying the expression values to use for</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1382" col1="1" line2="1382" col2="70" start="243233" end="243302">#' colouring the points, if \code{colour_by} is set as a feature name.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1383" col1="1" line2="1383" col2="79" start="243409" end="243487">#' @param theme_size numeric scalar giving default font size for plotting theme</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1384" col1="1" line2="1384" col2="19" start="243585" end="243603">#' (default is 10).</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1385" col1="1" line2="1385" col2="77" start="243761" end="243837">#' @param legend character, specifying how the legend(s) be shown? Default is</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1386" col1="1" line2="1386" col2="80" start="243937" end="244016">#' \code{"auto"}, which hides legends that have only one level and shows others.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1387" col1="1" line2="1387" col2="74" start="244113" end="244186">#' Alternatives are "all" (show all legends) or "none" (hide all legends).</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1388" col1="1" line2="1388" col2="2" start="244289" end="244290">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1389" col1="1" line2="1389" col2="75" start="244465" end="244539">#' @details This function expects plate positions to be given in a charcter</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1390" col1="1" line2="1390" col2="75" start="244641" end="244715">#' format where a letter indicates the row on the plate and a numeric value</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1391" col1="1" line2="1391" col2="80" start="244817" end="244896">#' indicates the column. So each cell has a plate position such as "A01", "B12",</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1392" col1="1" line2="1392" col2="75" start="244993" end="245067">#' "K24" and so on. From these plate positions, the row is extracted as the</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1393" col1="1" line2="1393" col2="78" start="245169" end="245246">#' letter, and the column as the numeric part. If \code{object$plate_position}</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1394" col1="1" line2="1394" col2="76" start="245345" end="245420">#' or the \code{plate_position} argument are used to define plate positions,</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1395" col1="1" line2="1395" col2="75" start="245521" end="245595">#' then positions should be provided in this format. Alternatively, numeric</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1396" col1="1" line2="1396" col2="66" start="245697" end="245762">#' values to be used as x- and y-coordinates by supplying both the</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1397" col1="1" line2="1397" col2="69" start="245873" end="245941">#' \code{x_position} and \code{y_position} arguments to the function.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1398" col1="1" line2="1398" col2="2" start="246049" end="246050">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1399" col1="1" line2="1399" col2="10" start="246225" end="246234">#' @return</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1400" col1="1" line2="1400" col2="19" start="246401" end="246419">#' A ggplot object.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1401" col1="1" line2="1401" col2="2" start="246577" end="246578">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1402" col1="1" line2="1402" col2="10" start="246753" end="246762">#' @export</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1403" col1="1" line2="1403" col2="2" start="246929" end="246930">#'</COMMENT>

  <COMMENT line1="1496" col1="1" line2="1496" col2="80" start="263297" end="263376">################################################################################</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1498" col1="1" line2="1498" col2="75" start="263649" end="263723">#' Plot expression values for a set of features (e.g. genes or transcripts)</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1499" col1="1" line2="1499" col2="2" start="263825" end="263826">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1500" col1="1" line2="1500" col2="94" start="264001" end="264094">#' @param object an \code{\link{SingleCellExperiment}} object containing expression values and</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1501" col1="1" line2="1501" col2="75" start="264177" end="264251">#' experimental information. Must have been appropriately prepared. For the</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1502" col1="1" line2="1502" col2="71" start="264353" end="264423">#' \code{plotExpressionDefault} method, the \code{object} argument is a</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1503" col1="1" line2="1503" col2="80" start="264529" end="264608">#' data.frame in 'long' format providing expression values for a set of features</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1504" col1="1" line2="1504" col2="77" start="264705" end="264781">#'  to plot, plus metadata used in the \code{aesth} argument, but this is not</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1505" col1="1" line2="1505" col2="39" start="264881" end="264919">#'  meant to be a user-level operation.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1506" col1="1" line2="1506" col2="65" start="265057" end="265121">#' @param features a character vector of feature names or Boolean</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1507" col1="1" line2="1507" col2="76" start="265233" end="265308">#' vector or numeric vector of indices indicating which features should have</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1508" col1="1" line2="1508" col2="34" start="265409" end="265442">#' their expression values plotted</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1509" col1="1" line2="1509" col2="79" start="265585" end="265663">#' @param x character string providing a column name of \code{pData(object)} or</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1510" col1="1" line2="1510" col2="72" start="265761" end="265832">#' a feature name (i.e. gene or transcript) to plot on the x-axis in the</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1511" col1="1" line2="1511" col2="80" start="265937" end="266016">#' expression plot(s). If a feature name, then expression values for the feature</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1512" col1="1" line2="1512" col2="50" start="266113" end="266162">#' will be plotted on the x-axis for each subplot.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1513" col1="1" line2="1513" col2="78" start="266289" end="266366">#' @param exprs_values character string indicating which values should be used</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1514" col1="1" line2="1514" col2="75" start="266465" end="266539">#' as the expression values for this plot. Valid arguments are \code{"tpm"}</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1515" col1="1" line2="1515" col2="63" start="266641" end="266703">#' (transcripts per million), \code{"norm_tpm"} (normalised TPM</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1516" col1="1" line2="1516" col2="76" start="266817" end="266892">#' values), \code{"fpkm"} (FPKM values), \code{"norm_fpkm"} (normalised FPKM</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1517" col1="1" line2="1517" col2="76" start="266993" end="267068">#' values), \code{"counts"} (counts for each feature), \code{"norm_counts"},</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1518" col1="1" line2="1518" col2="67" start="267169" end="267235">#' \code{"cpm"} (counts-per-million), \code{"norm_cpm"} (normalised</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1519" col1="1" line2="1519" col2="81" start="267345" end="267425">#' counts-per-million), \code{"logcounts"} (log-transformed count data; default),</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1520" col1="1" line2="1520" col2="34" start="267521" end="267554">#' \code{"norm_exprs"} (normalised</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1521" col1="1" line2="1521" col2="78" start="267697" end="267774">#' expression values) or \code{"stand_exprs"} (standardised expression values)</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1522" col1="1" line2="1522" col2="76" start="267873" end="267948">#' or any other slots that have been added to the \code{"assayData"} slot by</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1523" col1="1" line2="1523" col2="12" start="268049" end="268060">#' the user.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1524" col1="1" line2="1524" col2="75" start="268225" end="268299">#' @param colour_by optional character string supplying name of a column of</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1525" col1="1" line2="1525" col2="75" start="268401" end="268475">#' \code{pData(object)} which will be used as a variable by which to colour</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1526" col1="1" line2="1526" col2="78" start="268577" end="268654">#' expression values on the plot. Alternatively, a data frame with one column,</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1527" col1="1" line2="1527" col2="68" start="268753" end="268820">#' containing a value for each cell that will be mapped to a colour.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1528" col1="1" line2="1528" col2="74" start="268929" end="269002">#' @param shape_by optional character string supplying name of a column of</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1529" col1="1" line2="1529" col2="79" start="269105" end="269183">#' \code{pData(object)} which will be used as a variable to define the shape of</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1530" col1="1" line2="1530" col2="77" start="269281" end="269357">#' points for expression values on the plot. Alternatively, a data frame with</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1531" col1="1" line2="1531" col2="49" start="269457" end="269505">#' one column containing values to map to shapes.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1532" col1="1" line2="1532" col2="73" start="269633" end="269705">#' @param size_by optional character string supplying name of a column of</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1533" col1="1" line2="1533" col2="78" start="269809" end="269886">#' \code{pData(object)} which will be used as a variable to define the size of</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1534" col1="1" line2="1534" col2="77" start="269985" end="270061">#' points for expression values on the plot. Alternatively, a data frame with</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1535" col1="1" line2="1535" col2="48" start="270161" end="270208">#' one column containing values to map to sizes.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1536" col1="1" line2="1536" col2="70" start="270337" end="270406">#' @param ncol number of columns to be used for the panels of the plot</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1537" col1="1" line2="1537" col2="80" start="270513" end="270592">#' @param xlab label for x-axis; if \code{NULL} (default), then \code{x} will be</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1538" col1="1" line2="1538" col2="27" start="270689" end="270715">#' used as the x-axis label</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1539" col1="1" line2="1539" col2="73" start="270865" end="270937">#' @param show_median logical, show the median for each group on the plot</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1540" col1="1" line2="1540" col2="70" start="271041" end="271110">#' @param show_violin logical, show a violin plot for the distribution</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1541" col1="1" line2="1541" col2="29" start="271217" end="271245">#' for each group on the plot</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1542" col1="1" line2="1542" col2="80" start="271393" end="271472">#' @param show_smooth logical, show a smoothed fit through the expression values</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1543" col1="1" line2="1543" col2="15" start="271569" end="271583">#'  on the plot</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1544" col1="1" line2="1544" col2="82" start="271745" end="271826">#' @param alpha numeric value between 0 (completely transparent) and 1 (completely</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1545" col1="1" line2="1545" col2="68" start="271921" end="271988">#' solid) defining how transparent plotted points (cells) should be.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1546" col1="1" line2="1546" col2="77" start="272097" end="272173">#' Points are jittered horizontally if the x-axis value is categorical rather</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1547" col1="1" line2="1547" col2="38" start="272273" end="272310">#' than numeric to avoid overplotting.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1548" col1="1" line2="1548" col2="79" start="272449" end="272527">#' @param theme_size numeric scalar giving default font size for plotting theme</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1549" col1="1" line2="1549" col2="18" start="272625" end="272642">#' (default is 10)</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1550" col1="1" line2="1550" col2="72" start="272801" end="272872">#' @param log2_values should the expression values be transformed to the</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1551" col1="1" line2="1551" col2="73" start="272977" end="273049">#' log2-scale for plotting (with an offset of 1 to avoid logging zeroes)?</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1552" col1="1" line2="1552" col2="69" start="273153" end="273221">#' @param size numeric scalar optionally providing size for points if</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1553" col1="1" line2="1553" col2="78" start="273329" end="273406">#' \code{size_by} argument is not given. Default is \code{NULL}, in which case</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1554" col1="1" line2="1554" col2="33" start="273505" end="273537">#' \pkg{ggplot2} default is used.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1555" col1="1" line2="1555" col2="68" start="273681" end="273748">#' @param scales character scalar, should scales be fixed ("fixed"),</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1556" col1="1" line2="1556" col2="77" start="273857" end="273933">#' free ("free"), or free in one dimension ("free_x"; "free_y", the default).</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1557" col1="1" line2="1557" col2="89" start="274033" end="274121">#' Passed to the \code{scales} argument in the \code{\link[ggplot2]{facet_wrap}} function</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1558" col1="1" line2="1558" col2="35" start="274209" end="274243">#' from the \code{ggplot2} package.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1559" col1="1" line2="1559" col2="79" start="274385" end="274463">#' @param se logical, should standard errors be shown (default \code{TRUE}) for</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1560" col1="1" line2="1560" col2="87" start="274561" end="274647">#' the smoothed fit through the cells. (Ignored if \code{show_smooth} is \code{FALSE}).</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1561" col1="1" line2="1561" col2="77" start="274737" end="274813">#' @param jitter character scalar to define whether points are to be jittered</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1562" col1="1" line2="1562" col2="85" start="274913" end="274997">#' (\code{"jitter"}) or presented in a "beeswarm" style (if \code{"swarm"}; default).</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1563" col1="1" line2="1563" col2="80" start="275089" end="275168">#' "Beeswarm" style usually looks more attractive, but for datasets with a large</COMMENT>

  <COMMENT line1="1828" col1="1" line2="1828" col2="38" start="321729" end="321766">#' Plot metadata for cells or features</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1829" col1="1" line2="1829" col2="2" start="321905" end="321906">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1830" col1="1" line2="1830" col2="76" start="322081" end="322156">#' @param object a data.frame (or object that can be coerced to such) object</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1831" col1="1" line2="1831" col2="42" start="322257" end="322298">#' containing metadata in columns to plot.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1832" col1="1" line2="1832" col2="73" start="322433" end="322505">#' @param aesth aesthetics function call to pass to ggplot. This function</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1833" col1="1" line2="1833" col2="76" start="322609" end="322684">#' expects at least x and y variables to be supplied. The default is to plot</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1834" col1="1" line2="1834" col2="46" start="322785" end="322830">#' total_features against log10(total_counts).</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1835" col1="1" line2="1835" col2="80" start="322961" end="323040">#' @param shape numeric scalar to define the plotting shape. Ignored if shape is</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1836" col1="1" line2="1836" col2="41" start="323137" end="323177">#' included in the \code{aesth} argument.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1837" col1="1" line2="1837" col2="75" start="323313" end="323387">#' @param alpha numeric scalar (in the interval 0 to 1) to define the alpha</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1838" col1="1" line2="1838" col2="78" start="323489" end="323566">#' level (transparency) of plotted points. Ignored if alpha is included in the</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1839" col1="1" line2="1839" col2="25" start="323665" end="323689">#' \code{aesth} argument.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1840" col1="1" line2="1840" col2="77" start="323841" end="323917">#' @param size numeric scalar to define the plotting size. Ignored if size is</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1841" col1="1" line2="1841" col2="41" start="324017" end="324057">#' included in the \code{aesth} argument.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1842" col1="1" line2="1842" col2="79" start="324193" end="324271">#' @param theme_size numeric scalar giving default font size for plotting theme</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1843" col1="1" line2="1843" col2="18" start="324369" end="324386">#' (default is 10)</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1844" col1="1" line2="1844" col2="2" start="324545" end="324546">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1845" col1="1" line2="1845" col2="94" start="324721" end="324814">#' @details Plot cell or feature metadata from an SingleCellExperiment object. If one variable</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1846" col1="1" line2="1846" col2="75" start="324897" end="324971">#'  is supplied then a density plot will be returned. If both variables are</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1847" col1="1" line2="1847" col2="80" start="325073" end="325152">#' continuous (numeric) then a scatter plot will be returned. If one variable is</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1848" col1="1" line2="1848" col2="79" start="325249" end="325327">#' discrete and one continuous then a violin plot with jittered points overlaid</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1849" col1="1" line2="1849" col2="78" start="325425" end="325502">#' will be returned. If both variables are discrete then a jitter plot will be</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1850" col1="1" line2="1850" col2="74" start="325601" end="325674">#' produced. The object returned is a ggplot object, so further layers and</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1851" col1="1" line2="1851" col2="62" start="325777" end="325838">#' plotting options (titles, facets, themes etc) can be added.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1852" col1="1" line2="1852" col2="2" start="325953" end="325954">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1853" col1="1" line2="1853" col2="31" start="326129" end="326159">#' @return a ggplot plot object</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1854" col1="1" line2="1854" col2="2" start="326305" end="326306">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1855" col1="1" line2="1855" col2="18" start="326481" end="326498">#' @import viridis</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1856" col1="1" line2="1856" col2="10" start="326657" end="326666">#' @export</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1857" col1="1" line2="1857" col2="2" start="326833" end="326834">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1858" col1="1" line2="1858" col2="12" start="327009" end="327020">#' @examples</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1859" col1="1" line2="1859" col2="28" start="327185" end="327212">#' data("sc_example_counts")</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1860" col1="1" line2="1860" col2="31" start="327361" end="327391">#' data("sc_example_cell_info")</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1861" col1="1" line2="1861" col2="39" start="327537" end="327575">#' example_sce &lt;- SingleCellExperiment(</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1862" col1="1" line2="1862" col2="77" start="327713" end="327789">#' assays = list(counts = sc_example_counts), colData = sc_example_cell_info)</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="1863" col1="1" line2="1863" col2="49" start="327889" end="327937">#' example_sce &lt;- calculateQCMetrics(example_sce)</COMMENT>
