          <expr line1="2036" col1="9" line2="2036" col2="51" start="358345" end="358387">
            <expr line1="2036" col1="9" line2="2036" col2="16" start="358345" end="358352">
              <SYMBOL line1="2036" col1="9" line2="2036" col2="16" start="358345" end="358352">plot_out</SYMBOL>
            </expr>
            <LEFT_ASSIGN line1="2036" col1="18" line2="2036" col2="19" start="358354" end="358355">&lt;-</LEFT_ASSIGN>
            <expr line1="2036" col1="21" line2="2036" col2="51" start="358357" end="358387">
              <expr line1="2036" col1="21" line2="2036" col2="28" start="358357" end="358364">
                <SYMBOL line1="2036" col1="21" line2="2036" col2="28" start="358357" end="358364">plot_out</SYMBOL>
              </expr>
              <OP-PLUS line1="2036" col1="30" line2="2036" col2="30" start="358366" end="358366">+</OP-PLUS>
              <expr line1="2036" col1="32" line2="2036" col2="51" start="358368" end="358387">
                <expr line1="2036" col1="32" line2="2036" col2="37" start="358368" end="358373">
                  <SYMBOL_FUNCTION_CALL line1="2036" col1="32" line2="2036" col2="37" start="358368" end="358373">guides</SYMBOL_FUNCTION_CALL>
                </expr>
                <OP-LEFT-PAREN line1="2036" col1="38" line2="2036" col2="38" start="358374" end="358374">(</OP-LEFT-PAREN>
                <SYMBOL_SUB line1="2036" col1="39" line2="2036" col2="42" start="358375" end="358378">size</SYMBOL_SUB>
                <EQ_SUB line1="2036" col1="44" line2="2036" col2="44" start="358380" end="358380">=</EQ_SUB>
                <expr line1="2036" col1="46" line2="2036" col2="50" start="358382" end="358386">
                  <NUM_CONST line1="2036" col1="46" line2="2036" col2="50" start="358382" end="358386">FALSE</NUM_CONST>
                </expr>
                <OP-RIGHT-PAREN line1="2036" col1="51" line2="2036" col2="51" start="358387" end="358387">)</OP-RIGHT-PAREN>
              </expr>
            </expr>
          </expr>
        </expr>
        <COMMENT line1="2038" col1="5" line2="2038" col2="25" start="358693" end="358713">## Return plot object</COMMENT>
        <expr line1="2039" col1="5" line2="2039" col2="12" start="358869" end="358876">
          <SYMBOL line1="2039" col1="5" line2="2039" col2="12" start="358869" end="358876">plot_out</SYMBOL>
        </expr>
        <OP-RIGHT-BRACE line1="2040" col1="1" line2="2040" col2="1" start="359041" end="359041">}</OP-RIGHT-BRACE>
      </expr>
    </expr>
  </expr>
  <COMMENT line1="2043" col1="1" line2="2043" col2="80" start="359569" end="359648">################################################################################</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2045" col1="1" line2="2045" col2="63" start="359921" end="359983">#' Plot cell phenotype data from an SingleCellExperiment object</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2046" col1="1" line2="2046" col2="2" start="360097" end="360098">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2047" col1="1" line2="2047" col2="71" start="360273" end="360343">#' \code{plotPhenoData}, \code{plotColData} and \code{plotCellData} are</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2048" col1="1" line2="2048" col2="14" start="360449" end="360462">#' synonymous.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2049" col1="1" line2="2049" col2="2" start="360625" end="360626">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2050" col1="1" line2="2050" col2="94" start="360801" end="360894">#' @param object an \code{\link{SingleCellExperiment}} object containing expression values and</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2051" col1="1" line2="2051" col2="67" start="360977" end="361043">#' experimental information. Must have been appropriately prepared.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2052" col1="1" line2="2052" col2="73" start="361153" end="361225">#' @param aesth aesthetics function call to pass to ggplot. This function</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2053" col1="1" line2="2053" col2="76" start="361329" end="361404">#' expects at least x and y variables to be supplied. The default is to plot</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2054" col1="1" line2="2054" col2="46" start="361505" end="361550">#' total_features against log10(total_counts).</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2055" col1="1" line2="2055" col2="65" start="361681" end="361745">#' @param ... arguments passed to \code{\link{plotPhenoData}} (if</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2056" col1="1" line2="2056" col2="65" start="361857" end="361921">#' \code{\link{plotColData}} or \code{\link{plotCellData}}) or to</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2057" col1="1" line2="2057" col2="66" start="362033" end="362098">#' \code{\link{plotMetadata}}, e.g.\code{theme_size}, \code{size},</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2058" col1="1" line2="2058" col2="30" start="362209" end="362238">#' \code{alpha}, \code{shape}.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2059" col1="1" line2="2059" col2="2" start="362385" end="362386">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2060" col1="1" line2="2060" col2="86" start="362561" end="362646">#' @details Plot phenotype data from a SingleCellExperiment object. If one variable is</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2061" col1="1" line2="2061" col2="71" start="362737" end="362807">#' supplied then a density plot will be returned. If both variables are</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2062" col1="1" line2="2062" col2="80" start="362913" end="362992">#' continuous (numeric) then a scatter plot will be returned. If one variable is</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2063" col1="1" line2="2063" col2="79" start="363089" end="363167">#' discrete and one continuous then a violin plot with jittered points overlaid</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2064" col1="1" line2="2064" col2="78" start="363265" end="363342">#' will be returned. If both variables are discrete then a jitter plot will be</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2065" col1="1" line2="2065" col2="74" start="363441" end="363514">#' produced. The object returned is a ggplot object, so further layers and</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2066" col1="1" line2="2066" col2="62" start="363617" end="363678">#' plotting options (titles, facets, themes etc) can be added.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2067" col1="1" line2="2067" col2="2" start="363793" end="363794">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2068" col1="1" line2="2068" col2="31" start="363969" end="363999">#' @return a ggplot plot object</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2069" col1="1" line2="2069" col2="2" start="364145" end="364146">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2070" col1="1" line2="2070" col2="10" start="364321" end="364330">#' @export</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2071" col1="1" line2="2071" col2="12" start="364497" end="364508">#' @examples</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2072" col1="1" line2="2072" col2="28" start="364673" end="364700">#' data("sc_example_counts")</COMMENT>

  <COMMENT line1="2125" col1="1" line2="2125" col2="80" start="374001" end="374080">################################################################################</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2127" col1="1" line2="2127" col2="62" start="374353" end="374414">#' Plot feature (gene) data from a SingleCellExperiment object</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2128" col1="1" line2="2128" col2="2" start="374529" end="374530">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2129" col1="1" line2="2129" col2="64" start="374705" end="374768">#' \code{plotFeatureData} and \code{plotRowData} are synonymous.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2130" col1="1" line2="2130" col2="2" start="374881" end="374882">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2131" col1="1" line2="2131" col2="72" start="375057" end="375128">#' @param object an \code{\link{SingleCellExperiment}} object containing</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2132" col1="1" line2="2132" col2="89" start="375233" end="375321">#' expression values and experimental information. Must have been appropriately prepared.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2133" col1="1" line2="2133" col2="73" start="375409" end="375481">#' @param aesth aesthetics function call to pass to ggplot. This function</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2134" col1="1" line2="2134" col2="79" start="375585" end="375663">#' expects at least x and y variables to be supplied. The default is to produce</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2135" col1="1" line2="2135" col2="69" start="375761" end="375829">#' a density plot of number of cells expressing the feature (requires</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2136" col1="1" line2="2136" col2="95" start="375937" end="376031">#' \code{calculateQCMetrics} to have been run on the \code{SingleCellExperiment} object prior).</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2137" col1="1" line2="2137" col2="66" start="376113" end="376178">#' @param ... arguments passed to \code{\link{plotMetadata}}, e.g.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2138" col1="1" line2="2138" col2="62" start="376289" end="376350">#' \code{theme_size}, \code{size}, \code{alpha}, \code{shape}.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2139" col1="1" line2="2139" col2="2" start="376465" end="376466">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2140" col1="1" line2="2140" col2="92" start="376641" end="376732">#' @details Plot feature (gene) data from an SingleCellExperiment object. If one variable is</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2141" col1="1" line2="2141" col2="71" start="376817" end="376887">#' supplied then a density plot will be returned. If both variables are</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2142" col1="1" line2="2142" col2="80" start="376993" end="377072">#' continuous (numeric) then a scatter plot will be returned. If one variable is</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2143" col1="1" line2="2143" col2="79" start="377169" end="377247">#' discrete and one continuous then a violin plot with jittered points overlaid</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2144" col1="1" line2="2144" col2="78" start="377345" end="377422">#' will be returned. If both variables are discrete then a jitter plot will be</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2145" col1="1" line2="2145" col2="74" start="377521" end="377594">#' produced. The object returned is a ggplot object, so further layers and</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2146" col1="1" line2="2146" col2="62" start="377697" end="377758">#' plotting options (titles, facets, themes etc) can be added.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2147" col1="1" line2="2147" col2="2" start="377873" end="377874">#'</COMMENT>

  <COMMENT line1="2151" col1="1" line2="2151" col2="12" start="378577" end="378588">#' @examples</COMMENT>

  <COMMENT line1="2181" col1="1" line2="2181" col2="80" start="383857" end="383936">################################################################################</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2182" col1="1" line2="2182" col2="40" start="384033" end="384072">### Multiplot function for ggplot2 plots</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2184" col1="1" line2="2184" col2="43" start="384385" end="384427">#' Multiple plot function for ggplot2 plots</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2185" col1="1" line2="2185" col2="2" start="384561" end="384562">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2186" col1="1" line2="2186" col2="66" start="384737" end="384802">#' Place multiple \code{\link[ggplot2]{ggplot}} plots on one page.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2187" col1="1" line2="2187" col2="2" start="384913" end="384914">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2188" col1="1" line2="2188" col2="78" start="385089" end="385166">#' @param ...,plotlist ggplot objects can be passed in ..., or to plotlist (as</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2189" col1="1" line2="2189" col2="28" start="385265" end="385292">#' a list of ggplot objects)</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2190" col1="1" line2="2190" col2="72" start="385441" end="385512">#' @param cols numeric scalar giving the number of columns in the layout</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2191" col1="1" line2="2191" col2="75" start="385617" end="385691">#' @param layout a matrix specifying the layout. If present, \code{cols} is</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2192" col1="1" line2="2192" col2="11" start="385793" end="385803">#' ignored.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2193" col1="1" line2="2193" col2="2" start="385969" end="385970">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2194" col1="1" line2="2194" col2="43" start="386145" end="386187">#' @details If the layout is something like</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2195" col1="1" line2="2195" col2="76" start="386321" end="386396">#' \code{matrix(c(1,2,3,3), nrow=2, byrow=TRUE)}, then plot 1 will go in the</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2196" col1="1" line2="2196" col2="77" start="386497" end="386573">#' upper left, 2 will go in the upper right, and 3 will go all the way across</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2197" col1="1" line2="2197" col2="77" start="386673" end="386749">#' the bottom. There is no way to tweak the relative heights or widths of the</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2198" col1="1" line2="2198" col2="55" start="386849" end="386903">#' plots with this simple function. It was adapted from</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2199" col1="1" line2="2199" col2="80" start="387025" end="387104">#' \url{http://www.cookbook-r.com/Graphs/Multiple_graphs_on_one_page_(ggplot2)/}</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2200" col1="1" line2="2200" col2="2" start="387201" end="387202">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2201" col1="1" line2="2201" col2="38" start="387377" end="387414">#' @return a \code{ggplot} plot object</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2202" col1="1" line2="2202" col2="2" start="387553" end="387554">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2203" col1="1" line2="2203" col2="32" start="387729" end="387760">#' @importFrom grid grid.newpage</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2204" col1="1" line2="2204" col2="32" start="387905" end="387936">#' @importFrom grid pushViewport</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2205" col1="1" line2="2205" col2="28" start="388081" end="388108">#' @importFrom grid viewport</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2206" col1="1" line2="2206" col2="31" start="388257" end="388287">#' @importFrom grid grid.layout</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2207" col1="1" line2="2207" col2="10" start="388433" end="388442">#' @export</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2208" col1="1" line2="2208" col2="12" start="388609" end="388620">#' @examples</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2209" col1="1" line2="2209" col2="19" start="388785" end="388803">#' library(ggplot2)</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2210" col1="1" line2="2210" col2="73" start="388961" end="389033">#' ## This example uses the ChickWeight dataset, which comes with ggplot2</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2211" col1="1" line2="2211" col2="16" start="389137" end="389152">#' ## First plot</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2212" col1="1" line2="2212" col2="87" start="389313" end="389399">#' p1 &lt;- ggplot(ChickWeight, aes(x = Time, y = weight, colour = Diet, group = Chick)) +</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2213" col1="1" line2="2213" col2="19" start="389489" end="389507">#'    geom_line() +</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2214" col1="1" line2="2214" col2="51" start="389665" end="389715">#'    ggtitle("Growth curve for individual chicks")</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2215" col1="1" line2="2215" col2="17" start="389841" end="389857">#' ## Second plot</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2216" col1="1" line2="2216" col2="72" start="390017" end="390088">#' p2 &lt;- ggplot(ChickWeight, aes(x = Time, y = weight, colour = Diet)) +</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2217" col1="1" line2="2217" col2="30" start="390193" end="390222">#'    geom_point(alpha = .3) +</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2218" col1="1" line2="2218" col2="41" start="390369" end="390409">#'    geom_smooth(alpha = .2, size = 1) +</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2219" col1="1" line2="2219" col2="45" start="390545" end="390589">#'    ggtitle("Fitted growth curve per diet")</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2220" col1="1" line2="2220" col2="16" start="390721" end="390736">#' ## Third plot</COMMENT>

  <COMMENT line1="2268" col1="1" line2="2268" col2="45" start="399169" end="399213">### Plot expression against transcript length</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2271" col1="1" line2="2271" col2="44" start="399697" end="399740">#' Plot expression against transcript length</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2272" col1="1" line2="2272" col2="2" start="399873" end="399874">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2273" col1="1" line2="2273" col2="75" start="400049" end="400123">#' Plot expression values from an \code{\link{SingleCellExperiment}} object</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2274" col1="1" line2="2274" col2="78" start="400225" end="400302">#' against transcript length values defined in the SingleCellExperiment object</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2275" col1="1" line2="2275" col2="30" start="400401" end="400430">#' or supplied as an argument.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2276" col1="1" line2="2276" col2="2" start="400577" end="400578">#'</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2277" col1="1" line2="2277" col2="61" start="400753" end="400813">#' @param object an \code{\link{SingleCellExperiment}} object</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2278" col1="1" line2="2278" col2="80" start="400929" end="401008">#' @param tx_length transcript lengths to plot on the x-axis. Can be one of: (1)</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2279" col1="1" line2="2279" col2="82" start="401105" end="401186">#' the name of a column of \code{rowData(object)} containing the transcript length</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2280" col1="1" line2="2280" col2="76" start="401281" end="401356">#' values, or (2) the name of an element of \code{assays(object)} containing</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2281" col1="1" line2="2281" col2="80" start="401457" end="401536">#' a matrix of transcript length values, or (3) a numeric vector of length equal</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2282" col1="1" line2="2282" col2="63" start="401633" end="401695">#' to the number of rows of \code{object} (number of features).</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2283" col1="1" line2="2283" col2="78" start="401809" end="401886">#' @param exprs_values character string indicating which values should be used</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2284" col1="1" line2="2284" col2="75" start="401985" end="402059">#' as the expression values for this plot. Valid arguments are \code{"tpm"}</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2285" col1="1" line2="2285" col2="63" start="402161" end="402223">#' (transcripts per million), \code{"norm_tpm"} (normalised TPM</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2286" col1="1" line2="2286" col2="76" start="402337" end="402412">#' values), \code{"fpkm"} (FPKM values), \code{"norm_fpkm"} (normalised FPKM</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2287" col1="1" line2="2287" col2="76" start="402513" end="402588">#' values), \code{"counts"} (counts for each feature), \code{"norm_counts"},</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2288" col1="1" line2="2288" col2="67" start="402689" end="402755">#' \code{"cpm"} (counts-per-million), \code{"norm_cpm"} (normalised</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2289" col1="1" line2="2289" col2="81" start="402865" end="402945">#' counts-per-million), \code{"logcounts"} (log-transformed count data; default),</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2290" col1="1" line2="2290" col2="34" start="403041" end="403074">#' \code{"norm_exprs"} (normalised</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2291" col1="1" line2="2291" col2="78" start="403217" end="403294">#' expression values) or \code{"stand_exprs"} (standardised expression values)</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2292" col1="1" line2="2292" col2="73" start="403393" end="403465">#' or any other slots that have been added to the \code{"assays"} slot by</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2293" col1="1" line2="2293" col2="12" start="403569" end="403580">#' the user.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2294" col1="1" line2="2294" col2="75" start="403745" end="403819">#' @param colour_by optional character string supplying name of a column of</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2295" col1="1" line2="2295" col2="77" start="403921" end="403997">#' \code{rowData(object)} which will be used as a variable by which to colour</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2296" col1="1" line2="2296" col2="66" start="404097" end="404162">#' expression values on the plot. Alternatively, a data frame with</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2297" col1="1" line2="2297" col2="70" start="404273" end="404342">#' one column, containing a value for each feature to map to a colour.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2298" col1="1" line2="2298" col2="74" start="404449" end="404522">#' @param shape_by optional character string supplying name of a column of</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2299" col1="1" line2="2299" col2="81" start="404625" end="404705">#' \code{rowData(object)} which will be used as a variable to define the shape of</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2300" col1="1" line2="2300" col2="72" start="404801" end="404872">#' points for expression values on the plot. Alternatively, a data frame</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2301" col1="1" line2="2301" col2="54" start="404977" end="405030">#' with one column containing values to map to shapes.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2302" col1="1" line2="2302" col2="73" start="405153" end="405225">#' @param size_by optional character string supplying name of a column of</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2303" col1="1" line2="2303" col2="80" start="405329" end="405408">#' \code{rowData(object)} which will be used as a variable to define the size of</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2304" col1="1" line2="2304" col2="72" start="405505" end="405576">#' points for expression values on the plot. Alternatively, a data frame</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2305" col1="1" line2="2305" col2="53" start="405681" end="405733">#' with one column containing values to map to sizes.</COMMENT>
  <COMMENT line1="2306" col1="1" line2="2306" col2="80" start="405857" end="405936">#' @param xlab label for x-axis; if \code{NULL} (default), then \code{x} will be</COMMENT>
